page.title: 19CLIMATE WELLS-NEXT-THE-SEA
page.content: The severity of the winter is much modified by the coastal location of the area and most of the cereal crops are winter grown. However, conditions in the Spring with low rain fall amounts and temperatures above 5 degree C. are ideal for seed bed cultivation and germination of spring barley. Apparently detrimental to the role of the area as a holiday resort is the high rainfall in August. However this is restricted to a few rainy days with heavy showers or thunderstorms created by high land temperatures setting up convectional air currents. Increasing rainfall in October and November occasionally holds up the sugarbeet harvest but once again the modified winter temperatures mean that in this area the beet can be stored in the open without too much damage.
